data.title: Change Channels
data.statement:
This morning I spilled coffee on my TV remote control so that all digit buttons for channel selection were damaged. Luckily the channel Up and Down buttons (△ and ▽) remained intact. From now on I can rely only on the Up/Down buttons to change channels.

I have 100 channels in the TV, labeled as 0 to 99. Pressing Up (△) will increase the channel number. Pressing Down (▽) will do the reverse. For example, when it is on channel 3 and I want to change to channel 7, I have to press △ 4 times (3 -> 4 -> 5 -> 6 -> 7).

The channel numbers are running in a cycle. When it is 99, press △ will change channel to 0. When it is in 0, press ▽ will change channel to 99.

How many button presses are needed to change into wanted channels, if doing it in the most efficient way?
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read a:int b:int
write 4
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of channel change cases.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> Each line has integers [[a]] and [[b]] separated by a space. [[a]] is the current channel I am on; [[b]] is the channel I want to change to.
data.outputDescription: Output [[N]] lines. Each line is the <<minimum number of button pressing>> needed to do the channel change, corresponding to each input line.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

This morning I spilled coffee on my TV remote control so that all digit buttons for channel selection were damaged. Luckily the channel Up and Down buttons (△ and ▽) remained intact. From now on I can rely only on the Up/Down buttons to change channels.

I have 100 channels in the TV, labeled as 0 to 99. Pressing Up (△) will increase the channel number. Pressing Down (▽) will do the reverse. For example, when it is on channel 3 and I want to change to channel 7, I have to press △ 4 times (3 -> 4 -> 5 -> 6 -> 7).

The channel numbers are running in a cycle. When it is 99, press △ will change channel to 0. When it is in 0, press ▽ will change channel to 99.

How many button presses are needed to change into wanted channels, if doing it in the most efficient way?
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of channel change cases.
Next N lines: Each line has integers a and b separated by a space. a is the current channel I am on; b is the channel I want to change to.
Output
Output N lines. Each line is the minimum number of button pressing needed to do the channel change, corresponding to each input line.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 100
Example
Input
3
3 7
0 99
30 40
Output
4
1
10
